dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, kicking off Thursday, it wasn't exactly a stellar start for the markets, was it? We saw things open pretty much in the red.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, kicking off Thursday, it wasn't exactly a stellar start for the markets, was it? We saw things open pretty much in the red.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The market opened lower on Thursday, with more big banks reporting second quarter earnings, as investors grappled with the latest economic data showing the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic. KEY FACTS The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.6%, over 150 points, at Thursdays open, while the S&P 500 fell 0.6% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite lost 0.9%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely. I mean, after what, like, a pretty decent week leading up to it, I was kinda surprised. What was driving that, A?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely. I mean, after what, like, a pretty decent week leading up to it, I was kinda surprised. What was driving that, A?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before Thursday, stocks had largely been moving higher this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, a big one was the latest jobless claims data, B. Another 1.3 million Americans filed for unemployment last week. Worse than, uh, what we were expecting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, a big one was the latest jobless claims data, B. Another one point three million Americans filed for unemployment last week. Worse than, uh, what we were expecting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stocks fell after jobless claims data came in slightly worse than expected, with 1.3 million more Americans filing for unemployment in the week ending July 11, according to the Labor Department.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, that's just... that's not good news, is it? Though, I did see retail sales actually jumped in June, like, by 7.5%?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, that's just... that's not good news, is it? Though, I did see retail sales actually jumped in June, like, by seven point five percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail sales jumped by 7.5% in Junehigher than the 5.2% expected, but lower than last months record surge of 17.7%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Right, but still lower than last month's huge surge. And then we had bank earnings coming in. Bank of America actually beat estimates...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but still lower than last month's huge surge. And then we had bank earnings coming in. Bank of America actually beat estimates...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail sales jumped by 7.5% in Junehigher than the 5.2% expected, but lower than last months record surge of 17.7%. Major banks, meanwhile, continued to kick off second quarter earnings season: Bank of America topped estimates but its stock fell nearly 4% as the company set aside $4 billion for coronavirus-related losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But their stock still dropped, right? Because they had to set aside, like, four billion for potential losses, which is wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But their stock still dropped, right? Because they had to set aside, like, four billion for potential losses, which is wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bank of America topped estimates but its stock fell nearly 4% as the company set aside $4 billion for coronavirus-related losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Contrast that with Morgan Stanley, though, they just crushed it. Their stock was up, thanks to, um, surging trading revenues. Fixed income was up 170%!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Contrast that with Morgan Stanley, though, they just crushed it. Their stock was up, thanks to, um, surging trading revenues. Fixed income was up one hundred seventy percent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Morgan Stanley shares rose by almost 1% after the bank easily beat analyst expectations thanks to surging trading revenueswith its revenue from fixed income traders increasing by 170% last quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a massive difference. So some banks are really navigating this better than others, it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a massive difference. So some banks are really navigating this better than others, it seems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then, just to add to the chaos, the Twitter hack! That whole cryptocurrency scam, with Elon Musk and Joe Bidenâ€™s accounts. Twitter shares dropped, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, just to add to the chaos, the Twitter hack! That whole cryptocurrency scam, with Elon Musk and Joe Biden's accounts. Twitter shares dropped, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of social media platform Twitter dropped more than 3% following a massive digital currency scam late on Wednesday: Hackers gained access to dozens of high-profile accounts, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, former vice president Joe Biden and Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, I almost forgot about that! That was, like, a wild twenty-four hours. So, yeah, a lot going on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, I almost forgot about that! That was, like, a wild twenty-four hours. So, yeah, a lot going on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so all these factors, you know, pushing things down today, despite stocks mostly moving higher earlier in the week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so all these factors, you know, pushing things down today, despite stocks mostly moving higher earlier in the week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before Thursday, stocks had largely been moving higher this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the background to all of this, let's be real, is still those surging COVID cases. Like, over 67,000 new cases just the other day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the background to all of this, let's be real, is still those surging C O V I D cases. Like, over sixty seven thousand new cases just the other day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But recent gains come amid a backdrop of surging coronavirus infections across the country, however: The U.S. reported a new daily record of more than 67,000 cases earlier this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Absolutely, B. That's the underlying tension, right? Despite some good news, that cloud is still very much there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, B. That's the underlying tension, right? Despite some good news, that cloud is still very much there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It makes everything feel so, uh, uncertain, doesn't it? A real mixed bag out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes everything feel so, uh, uncertain, doesn't it? A real mixed bag out there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. A day where investors really had to grapple with, like, *all* the economic fallout.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. A day where investors really had to grapple with, like, all the economic fallout.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The market opened lower on Thursday, with more big banks reporting second quarter earnings, as investors grappled with the latest economic data showing the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.
